titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: On this day Harold arrived to enter formally on his residence in this house. He brought from his parents messages couched in grateful terms. I trust it may turn out well.

body.p: On Thursday, the 4th Jany, we had the choirboys of S. Margaret's to a "party". Gerald turned up, & distributed his toys. My wife came down to entertain the youngsters, but she ought perhaps to have stayed upstairs.
